document.heading: Financial Institutions Deposit and Investment Amendment Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-56, the “Financial Institutions Deposit and Investment Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-264, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 22, 1997, and October 7, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 17, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-177 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-56 became effective on March 18, 1998.
